title: The Walking Dead season 10 ratings drop again to another series low
text:
The Walking Dead has suffered another ratings slump (Picture: AMC)

The Walking Dead has reportedly had another slump in the ratings as season 10 continued with the terrifying introduction of a new character.

The second episode of the current season has broken the AMC show’s own record for the lowest rated episode of the series, according to Deadline.

It fetched 3.47 million viewers, down from the opening episode which saw 4 million people tune in.

The zombie drama came second place to the ACLS clash between the New York Yankees and Houston Astros.

It is believed that having the episodes available to watch two days in advance on subscription streaming service AMC Premiere might have something to with the low ratings.

The episode, titled We Are The End Of The World, revealed the origins of The Whisperers, particularly Alpha and how she ended up meeting Beta.

We were also introduced to seemingly power-mad Gamma in a way that will stay with us for a long time.

We were introduced to the terrifying Gamma (Picture: AMC)

The episode left us asking some serious questions, including whether the dangerous Gamma has plans to usurp Alpha as the head of The Whisperers.

Fans have been treated to a teaser of the next episode which hints at a clash between Alpha and Carol.

If that doesn’t give the ratings a boost, there is always the exit of long-time star Danai Gurira which is going to be an emotional one.

Star Samantha Morton recently spoke about playing ‘incredible badass survivor’ Alpha.

‘She’s been so practical in protecting her daughter and surviving that she doesn’t have much stuff with her,’ she told The Hollywood Reporter.

‘While her decisions may look awful to someone else, she is not going to at any point do anything that would get in the way of protecting her daughter.’

Morton also revealed that she prepared for the intense role by watching documentaries on cults.

Going on to describe Alpha as a ‘f****d-up eco warrior’ she said: ‘She thinks that at the end of the day, everyone has wars. She just wants to live — weirdly, peacefully, as a Whisperer. You have to remember that: she didn’t start this trouble. She’s just… finishing it.’

The Walking Dead airs Sundays at 9pm on AMC in the US and Mondays at 9pm on Fox in the UK.
